pain_points_original.title: Australian Legal Jurisdiction Accuracy
pain_points_original.description: Generic AI models often lack local legal context. As the central legal service provider, AGS specifically requires tools "designed to support Australian legal practices" rather than general models, ensuring relevance for their 570 lawyers covering 40 areas of government law.

pain_points_original.title: High-Assurance Security & Sovereignty
pain_points_original.description: Handling sensitive government data requires strict compliance. The solution MUST be "independently certified through IRAP process at PROTECTED level" and ensure "Customer data is stored and processed within the Australian Region" to mitigate national security and privacy risks.

pain_points_original.title: Legal Workflow Productivity
pain_points_original.description: Manual legal tasks consume valuable time. AGS seeks to "improve productivity across legal practice workflows" by automating high-volume tasks such as "Draft document from Standard Request," "Summarising legal documents," and generating "Case chronologies" for its ~800 staff.

pain_points_original.title: Complex Task Automation (Agentic AI)
pain_points_original.description: Standard generative AI is limited to single inputs. AGS needs to solve complex, multi-step problems and is specifically interested in "agentic AI systems" capable of "task orchestration" and "autonomous decision-making" to extend value beyond basic generation.

pain_points_original.title: Seamless Ecosystem Integration
pain_points_original.description: New tools must not create operational silos. AGS states the AI must "supplement rather than replace" existing tools and must integrate with the current tech stack, specifically "iManage Cloud, Elite 3E and the Microsoft Office suite."

pain_points_original.title: AI Explainability and Ethics
pain_points_original.description: Black-box decision making is unacceptable in government legal work. The solution must ensure that "All Artificial Intelligence (AI) use is ethical, responsible, transparent and explainable," allowing lawyers to verify how recommendations or actions were reached.

pain_points_original.title: Large-Scale Evidence Review Efficiency
pain_points_original.description: Reviewing large datasets manually is inefficient. AGS faces the challenge of identifying relevant docs in large sets; they need "Automated discovery / document review" and tools to "Identify inconsistencies across evidence" (e.g., transcripts, affidavits).

pain_points_original.title: Quality Assurance & Style Enforcement
pain_points_original.description: Inconsistent drafting risks professional reputation. AGS needs to solve the problem of manual quality checks by using AI for "Style Guide enforcement" to check consistency against "AGS style and plain English rules" across communications.
